metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10208 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was discovered in postgresql versions 9.4.x before 9.4.24, 9.5.xbefore 9.5.19, 9.6.x before 9.6.15, 10.x before 10.10 and 11.x before 11.5where arbitrary SQL statements can be executed given a suitable SECURITYDEFINER function. An attacker, with EXECUTE permission on the function, canexecute arbitrary SQL as the owner of the function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10208` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 9.5.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libecpg6 - 9.5.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 9.5.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libpq5 - 9.5.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
postgresql-9.5 - 9.5.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
postgresql-client-9.5 - 9.5.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
postgresql-contrib-9.5 - 9.5.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
postgresql-plperl-9.5 - 9.5.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
postgresql-plpython-9.5 - 9.5.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-9.5 - 9.5.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-9.5 - 9.5.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.5 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.5.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
